instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00928A: What is 820-00928A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Data recovery over special port not working.
threads.message:
Hello

I got this MB, water dropped  on MacBook. I took MB out, tried with Apple MISP tool connected directly to the MB but doesn't work. Never had issue with those port in the past. Is there a common know problem that could occured with those special recovery port ?

Thanks
Sam

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Data recovery over special port not working.
threads.message:
Do you get SSD power rails when connect the recovery tool?
Check for short on SSD coils...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Data recovery over special port not working.
threads.message: Case closed, there seems to be a bad connection somewhere but I had access to the data.
